name: Coimbra
fun_fact: Fun fact: Coimbra's University, founded in 1290, is one of the oldest in Europe, and the tradition of Fado de Coimbra (sung by students in black capes) at Caf√© Santa Cruz dates back to 1923 - making it the only place where you can sip espresso in a medieval chapel while listening to heartbreak sung by future lawyers.

hero_dishes.name: Leit√£o √† Bairrada
hero_dishes.description: Roasted suckling pig with impossibly crispy skin and tender, flavorful meat - Coimbra's most iconic dish
hero_dishes.origin_story: The nearby Bairrada region is famous for this dish, where piglets are roasted in special ovens until the skin shatters like glass. It's so beloved that locals make pilgrimages to specific restaurants known for the perfect crackling
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Traditional restaurants specializing in Bairrada cuisine, mentioned throughout Coimbra dining guides

hero_dishes.name: Chanfana
hero_dishes.description: Rich goat stew slow-cooked in red wine, garlic, and bay leaves in a clay pot - rustic and deeply satisfying
hero_dishes.origin_story: This hearty dish originated in convents where nuns would cook tough old goats in wine until tender. At Z√© Manel dos Ossos, they also serve feijoada de javali (wild boar stew) that locals swear by
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Z√© Manel dos Ossos (local institution with quirky bone d√©cor), traditional tascas

hero_dishes.name: Wild Boar Dishes
hero_dishes.description: Oven-baked wild boar or feijoada de javali (bean stew with wild boar) - gamey, rich, and traditional
hero_dishes.origin_story: At Z√© Manel dos Ossos, a tiny six-table tasca with walls covered in customer-written poems and bones, wild boar is essential. Ask for a half portion of the feijoada and a jug of house wine

hero_dishes.name: Bacalhau (Codfish) Dishes
hero_dishes.description: Salt cod prepared in countless ways - √† Br√°s (with eggs and potatoes) or com Natas (with cream) being favorites
hero_dishes.origin_story: Portuguese cuisine is said to have 365 ways to prepare bacalhau, one for each day of the year. Coimbra's versions are particularly beloved, using the finest Norwegian cod

signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Sipped in small glasses before or after meals. Some versions include the whole cherries at the bottom of the glass
